medical_history.chief_complaint: Sharp pain in right lower quadrant (RLQ).
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient first noted burning pain in the epigastrium two days prior to presentation. The pain then migrated to the RLQ and became sharp in nature, with episodes that are waxing and waning. Yesterday evening, he developed a fever and experienced non-bilious nausea and vomiting. No diarrhea or changes in stool noted. He has decreased appetite and denies reflux.
